medical_history.chief_complaint: Generalized abdominal pain with localized right lower quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced generalized abdominal discomfort last week, initially thought to be constipation, which resolved 3 days ago. Two nights ago, he developed more severe lower abdominal pain, which persisted into the following morning. The pain escalated and localized to the right lower quadrant by 5 PM the previous afternoon. The patient also reported nausea but no vomiting, fever, chills, diarrhea, or dysuria. No prior episodes of similar pain were noted.
